Articles.Content:
My question is asking for opinions/observations.

Have any of you noticed that actually undocking, docking ports works more smoothly than decoupling them?

When you launch a ship which has something attached to one of its docking ports - ie a lander, a probe or just a nosecone - that can be decoupled. But when you have two different ships and have docked them together, eg at a space station, the way to separate them is to undock.
